title: Iran steps up enforcement of mandatory hijab for women
description: After months of women-led protests, Iranian authorities are cracking down on those who do not wear a headscarf in public.

title: Son of Iran's last shah set to make first visit to Israel
description: Iran’s exiled crown prince is scheduled to come to Israel this week

title: Iran: Jail terms for those behind downing of Ukraine flight
description: Iran’s state media says a court has sentenced an air defense commander allegedly responsible for the deadly downing of a passenger plane amid Iran-U.S. tensions several years ago

title: Veterans of violence, Sudan’s weary doctors brave another crisis
description: Sudan's doctors struggle with exhaustion, blood shortages and violence that has claimed some of their own as they try to treat a massive influx of wounded.

title: He's been Mexico's voice abroad. Now he wants the presidency
description: He’s been the face of Mexico internationally for nearly five years and often the country’s leading voice in meetings with top world leaders — including volatile ones, like former U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Red Cross: Yemen’s warring sides wrap up major prisoner swap
description: The Red Cross says Yemen’s warring sides have wrapped up a major exchange of prisoners linked to the country’s long-running conflict

title: Russians boasted that just 1% of fake social profiles are caught, leak shows
description: An analysis of Russia’s effectiveness at boosting propaganda on social media platforms is part of a trove of documents recently leaked on the chat app Discord.

title: Reports: Militants kill 26 people in Syrian countryside
description: Reports say Islamic State militants have killed 26 people who were foraging for wild truffles in Syria’s Hama region

title: Fishermen at Japan PM attack acted fast to swarm suspect
description: Fishermen in the Japanese port town where Prime Minister Fumio Kishida escaped unhurt when a man tossed an explosive device at him described how their swift action saved the day

title: Pope slams 'insinuations' against John Paul II as baseless
description: Pope Francis has publicly defended St. John Paul II, slamming as “offensive and baseless” what he called recent insinuations about the late pontiff

title: Dozens of POWs freed as Ukraine marks Orthodox Easter
description: A top Ukrainian official says more than 100 Ukrainian prisoners of war have been released in a major Easter exchange with Russia

title: Syria's FM to Algeria, Tunisia to revive diplomatic ties
description: Syria’s chief diplomat is on a visit to Algeria and Tunisia as part of efforts to revive diplomatic relationships in the Arab world

title: 10 people returning from a funeral die in Kenya bus crash
description: Police say at least 10 people died when the bus they were traveling in left the road and rolled several times in southern Kenya

title: Climate envoy Kerry: No rolling back clean energy transition
description: U.S. envoy on climate change John Kerry says so much has been invested in clean energy that there can be no rolling back of moves to end carbon emissions

title: Traffic collision kills 7 police officers in Pakistan's SW
description: Pakistani police say a traffic collision in the southwest killed seven officers as they were returning to their hometowns for the Eid holidays

title: Dozens killed as army, rivals battle for control of Sudan
description: The Sudanese military and a powerful paramilitary group are battling for control of the chaos-stricken nation for a second day

title: Fire in Dubai kills 16, injures 9 in apartment building
description: A fire has swept through an apartment building in an older neighborhood of Dubai in the United Arab Emirates, killing at least 16 people and injuring another nine

title: More than 6,000 troops to play role in Charles' coronation
description: More than 6,000 British military personnel will take part in the coronation of King Charles III, the U.K. forces’ biggest ceremonial deployment in seven decades

title: At least 56 civilians killed in Sudan clashes, doctors union says
description: The fighting follows a spike in tensions between the Rapid Support Forces paramilitary group and the military.

title: Young people drive bullfighting's resurrection in Spain
description: The death of Spanish bullfighting has been declared many times, but the number of bullfights in the country is at its highest level in seven years, and the young are the most consistent presence as older groups of spectators drop away

title: Flights out of Taipei delayed after China launches satellite
description: Flights out of northern Taiwan were delayed Sunday after China launched a rocket carrying a satellite that dropped debris into waters north of the capital Taipei

title: India sees signs of renewed Sikh separatism and sounds the alarm
description: Security concerns have recently spiked as police have hunted the self-described separatist Amritpal Singh

title: 6 soldiers killed in attack in Indonesia's restive Papua
description: Separatist gunmen have opened fire on a military post in Indonesia’s restive Papua province, killing at least six soldiers and leaving dozens of others missing

title: Ukraine live briefing: Chinese defense minister begins Russia trip; 11 dead in rocket strike
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky said at least 50 buildings were destroyed and some 20 people injured after the strike on the Ukrainian city of Sloviansk.
